Author: Oliver Westbrook#7752
Content: Is there a way to pull total supply?

Author: Oliver Westbrook#7752
Content: Not seeing it as an option in the api ref

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
@Oliver Westbrook use like this
```
./komodo-cli coinsupply 100000
{
  "result": "success",
  "coin": "KMD",
  "height": 100000,
  "supply": 100299872.89777846,
  "zfunds": 0.00000000,
  "sprout": 0.00000000,
  "total": 100299872.89777846
}
```
go step by step and increase 100000 blocks each time.
so, the next command would be 
```
./komodo-cli coinsupply 200000
```
... to final 1324568
```
./komodo-cli coinsupply 1324568
```

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: don't try to count all block in KMD in the beginning, which will most likely not work and get stuck

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: once you have supply of until latest block, if you don't nuke data dir, you can continue counting new blocks without having to start from the beginning

Author: Oliver Westbrook#7752
Content: Okay, thank you for this. I was looking for a way to do this with an explorer api, for those online stores using veruspay which wouldn't have blockchain integration, but would be falling back to using the explorer in the case the wallet is unavailable or crashes

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: actually, it is already documented https://developers.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/komodo-api/blockchain.html#coinsupply

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: instead of 100k blocks the doc shows 10k block increment

Author: Oliver Westbrook#7752
Content: okay

Author: Oliver Westbrook#7752
Content: here's what I'm looking for, a KMD version of this: https://explorer.vrsc.0x03.services/ext/getmoneysupply

Author: Oliver Westbrook#7752
Content: just a quick restful api

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: i believe @CHMEX can do that for you. he is already showing total supply for each chains here https://dexstats.info/explorers.php

Content: it's an extremely slow RPC and should be aggressively cached

Author: zack#6467
Content:
https://github.com/zack-bitcoin/amoveo/blob/master/docs/other_blockchains/fast_oracles.md
I made a review of the oracle design @jl777c  recently published.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: thanks! yes, I didnt go into much details about the one day delay, by doing an average value of the previous 24hrs correlated data. the correlated data needs to be within tolerance to 51% of the prior 24hrs data, starting with a deterministically random sample from the past 24hrs. This one day delay still might not be enough time, but it at least gives more time that the realtime blocks.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and yes, chains that are created on demand for a specific purpose would work around the missing history issue, i didnt want to conflate the notarizations with the oracles as that makes the analysis much more complex

Author: allbits#5898
Content: "I am honored that jl777 would consider reusing ideas from Amoveo's oracle in his work." - so cool what can happen when two really smart guys vigorously debate each other, but with mutual respect and tolerance. Unlike the usual "drive by analysis" and suspicion that seems to predominate in this industry.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @zack it's really nice to see a thoughtful analysis of constructive criticism, very classy of you

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: not enough of that going around our industry

Author: allbits#5898
Content:
"This new oracle design takes advantage of how easy it is to make new blockchains with specialized consensus in Komodo. Taking advantage of these tools from Komodo seems like a promising way to find innovations in oracle design."

This is a key takeaway. Ease of experimentation with specialized consensus seems to be leading to a round of intense innovation and discovery.

Author: allbits#5898
Content: Big respect for @Zack. He took a lot of verbal shots when he first started sharing his knowledge here. Persevered tho.

Author: Alright#0419
Content:
A recent change to getaddresstxids rpc command seems to have broken insight support for CC vouts
http://kmdice.explorer.dexstats.info/address/REabWB7KjFN5C3LFMZ5odExHPenYzHLtVw
this is the global address for dice CC

Author: Alright#0419
Content: should have *tonnes* of txes

Author: Alright#0419
Content: the new behavior only shows CC vouts if an additional arg of `1` is added to it

Author: Alright#0419
Content: One strange thing I noticed is that it will show CC vouts if they are unconfirmed, not sure what else relies on this rpc command, but I think that might cause problems

Content: @CHMEX insight is not my forte, maybe you could check this out?
